head.title: Metro Briefing | New Jersey: Trenton: Nuclear Decision Is Appealed

hedline.hl1: Metro Briefing | New Jersey: Trenton: Nuclear Decision Is Appealed

abstract.p: New Jersey officials ask federal appeals court to overturn decision by Nuclear Regulatory Commission not to factor in possibility of terrorist attack on Oyster Creek nuclear plant; say it should be consideration in deciding whether to extend plant's license; Oyster Creek, country's oldest operating plant, is seeking to extend its license 20 years beyond its 2009 expiration date (S)

block.p: New Jersey officials asked a federal appeals court yesterday to overturn a decision by the Nuclear Regulatory Commission that the possibility of a terrorist attack on the Oyster Creek nuclear plant should not be a consideration in deciding whether to extend its license. Oyster Creek, the country's oldest operating plant, is seeking to extend its license for 20 years beyond its 2009 expiration date. In reviewing the potential environmental impact of continued operation, the N.R.C. did not take terrorism into account, and state officials claim that the commission erred. They have appealed the decision in the United States Court of Appeals for the Third Circuit.
